neque compescāris: extulērunt caput. ^ for behold thy enemies have made a noise
Deus: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.

quis similis erit tibi? Nē taceās: et cōgitāvērunt adversus sānctōs tuōs. ^ They have taken a malicious counsel against thy people
neque compescāris: and have consulted against thy saints.
et nōn memorētur nōmen Isrāēlis ultrā. ^ They have said: Come
Deus: and let us destroy them so that they be not a nation
^ O God: and let the name of Israel be remembered no more.

2 ^ Deus: 6 ^ Quoniam cōgitāvērunt ūnanimiter; simul adversum tē testāmentum disposuērunt
quis similis erit tibi? Nē taceās: ^ For they have contrived with one consent; they have made a covenant together against thee

2 ^ Deus: 7 ^ tabernācula Idūmaeōrum et Ismahelītae; Moab et Aggarēnī
quis similis erit tibi? Nē taceās: ^ the tabernacle of the Edomites and the Ishmahelites

Deus: the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre

quis similis erit tibi? Nē taceās: factī sunt in adjūtōrium fīliīs Lot. ^ and even the Assyrian is joined with them
neque compescāris: they are come to the aid of the sons of Lot.

2 ^ Deus: 10 ^ Fac illīs sīcut Madian et Sisarae
quis similis erit tibi? Nē taceās: sīcut Jabin in torrente Cisson. ^ Do to them as thou didst to Madian and to Sisara
neque compescāris: as to Jabin at the brook of Cisson.

2 ^ Deus: 11 ^ Disperīvērunt in Endōre; factī sunt ut stercus terrae. ^ Who perished at Endor; and became as dung for the earth.
12 ^ Pōne principēs eōrum sīcut Oreb et Zeb et Zebee et Salmana; omnēs principēs eōrum
quis similis erit tibi? Nē taceās: ^ Make their princes like Oreb and Zeb and Zebee and Salmana; all their princes

2 ^ Deus: 13 ^ quī dīxērunt: Hērēditāte possideāmus sānctuārium Deī. ^ who have said: Let us possess the sanctuary of God for an inheritance.

neque compescāris: et sīcut stipulam ante faciem ventī. ^ O my God
^ O God: and as stubble before the wind.

neque compescāris: ^ As fire which burneth the wood
Deus: and as a flame burning mountains

2 ^ Deus: 16 ^ ita persequeris illōs in tempestāte tuā
quis similis erit tibi? Nē taceās: et in īrā tuā turbābis eōs. ^ so shalt thou pursue them with thy tempest
neque compescāris: and shalt trouble them in thy wrath.
Domine. ^ Fill their faces with shame
Deus: and they shall seek thy name
et periant. ^ Let them be ashamed and troubled for ever and ever
^ O God: and let them be confounded and perish.

2 ^ Deus: 19 ^ Et cognōscant quia nōmen tibi Dominus; tū sōlus Altissimus in omnī terrā. ^ And let them know that the Lord is thy name; thou alone art the Most High over all the earth.
